text: Marie-Berthe Cazin (born 16 August 1872 in Boulogne-sur-Mer (Pas-de-Calais)); died 1 June 1971 in Sèvres (Hauts-de-Seine)) was a French woman painter, potter, goldsmith. == Biography == Marie-Berthe Cazin (née Yvart) was married to Jean-Marie Michel Cazin,Jean-Michel Cazin jasonjacques.comGazette des beaux-arts 1920; Michel Cazin (1869-1917) bnf.fr and studied with her father, Jean-Charles Cazin.Bénézit, 2006: CAZIN, Marie Berthe (1872-1971) oxfordindex.oup.com She produced mostly decorative works, such as vases and plates, working in ceramic, hammered copper and silver, leather, horn and other. It is believed that she worked alongside Jean-Michel throughout his entire career in ceramics and that many of the vases signed Jean-Michel were actually made by Berthe."Berthe Cazin" , jasonjacques.com At some point she began to sign her ceramic work, which typically feature incised and relief floral decoration. In 1913 she participated in the exposition with Henriette Tirman in Lyceum-Club.'L'Art et les artistes: revue mensuelle d'art ancien et moderne...' 1912-1913, bnf.fr ==References == == Notes == * Bénézit, 1999: CAZIN, Marie Berthe (1872-1971) Category:1872 births Category:1971 deaths Category:French potters Category:19th-century French painters Category:20th- century French painters Category:School of Paris Category:Women potters Category:20th-century French women artists Category:19th-century French women artists Category:French ceramists Category:French women ceramists
